intro: Leontodon rosanoi, commonly known as the Rosano leontodon, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are usually yellow to orange in color, and it produces achenes as its fruit type. Leontodon rosanoi is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
